dt: {bc}{d_link|obligatory|obligatory} tasks, conduct, service, or functions that arise from one's position (as in life or in a group)

dt.t: was his {wi}duty{/wi} to support his family
Her primary {wi}duty{/wi} at the meeting was to take attendance.
felt it was their {wi}duty{/wi} to help

dt: {bc}the service required (as of an electric machine) under specified conditions

dt.t: got double {wi}duty{/wi} out of the trip
making the word do {wi}duty{/wi} for the thing
a police officer who was {it}off duty{/it} at the time

dt: {bc}engaged in or responsible for an assigned task or duty

dt.t: not allowed to take personal calls while {it}on duty{/it}

pt: {sc}function{/sc} {sc}office{/sc} {sc}duty{/sc} {sc}province{/sc} mean the acts or operations expected of a person or thing. {sc}function{/sc} implies a definite end or purpose or a particular kind of work.

pt.t: the {it}function{/it} of language is two-fold: to communicate emotion and to give information

pt: {sc}office{/sc} is typically applied to the function or service associated with a trade or profession or a special relationship to others.

pt.t: they exercise the {it}offices{/it} of the judge, the priest, the counsellor

pt: {sc}duty{/sc} applies to a task or responsibility imposed by one's occupation, rank, status, or calling.

pt.t: it is the judicial {it}duty{/it} of the court, to examine the whole case

pt: {sc}province{/sc} applies to a function, office, or duty that naturally or logically falls to one.

pt.t: I felt it was not my {it}province{/it} to inquire

pt: {sc}task{/sc} {sc}duty{/sc} {sc}job{/sc} {sc}chore{/sc} {sc}stint{/sc} {sc}assignment{/sc} mean a piece of work to be done. {sc}task{/sc} implies work imposed by a person in authority or an employer or by circumstance.
{sc}duty{/sc} implies an obligation to perform or responsibility for performance.
{sc}job{/sc} applies to a piece of work voluntarily performed; it may sometimes suggest difficulty or importance.

pt.t: the {it}job{/it} of turning the company around

pt: {sc}chore{/sc} implies a minor routine activity necessary for maintaining a household or farm.
{sc}stint{/sc} implies a carefully allotted or measured quantity of assigned work or service.
{sc}assignment{/sc} implies a definite limited task assigned by one in authority.

et: Middle English {it}duete{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}deueté, dueté{/it}, from {it}deu{/it} due
shortdef: conduct due to parents and superiors : respect
obligatory tasks, conduct, service, or functions that arise from one's position (as in life or in a group)

dt: {bc}duty in the U.S. Navy performed with a deployable unit (such as a ship or aircraft squadron)

shortdef: duty in the U.S. Navy performed with a deployable unit (such as a ship or aircraft squadron)

dt: {bc}temporary military service away from one's permanent duty station

shortdef: temporary military service away from one's permanent duty station
